text:
Just downloaded build http-2.0_20020501161219
httpd-2.0/srclib/apr/build/buildcheck.sh  produces following error:

buildconf: checking installation...
Unknown option: 1
Usage: head [-options] <url>...

Problem is conflict with other program called 'head'.
Solution. head -v reveals following info:
----
This is lwp-request version 1.40 (libwww-perl-5.63)

Copyright 1995-1999, Gisle Aas.

This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
modify it under the same terms as Perl itself.
------
I installed libwww-perl a few weeks ago. I guess this perl module 
overwrote the defaut Darwin 'head' program.

I got the original 'head' from another OSX user and put it back and all is 
good now.
creator: dr_mac@mail.utexas.edu

text:
I guess this is more of an FYI than actual bug. I will leave it open so 
someone at Apache.org reads it and can accomidate buildcheck.sh for 
this maby by including their own 'head' like they do with libtool.
creator: dr_mac@mail.utexas.edu
slive@apache.org
text:
Hmmm... I'm going to go out on a limb and say that we're not going to fix this.
We have to rely on certain things being in the path and being relatively
similar to the standard: make, cat, cp, etc.

Thanks for using Apache!
